titleStmt.title: The fourth humble address of several societies of baptized believers (commonly called Anabaptists) in the county of Lincoln; humbly presented to Charles the II. King of Great Brittain, &c. containing their faithful representation, sober vindication, true thankfulness, peaceable and constant resolution, and humble petition, &c.

The fourth humble address of several societies of baptized believers (commonly called Anabaptists) in the county of Lincoln; humbly presented to Charles the II. King of Great Brittain, &c. containing their faithful representation, sober vindication, true thankfulness, peaceable and constant resolution, and humble petition, &c.
